ratings.comment: It's clear Prof. Schmidt knows her stuff about H.C. Andersen and she conveys her enthusiasm to students. That being said, the class themes seemed to repeat and lectures got boring fast; I spent a lot of time on Twitter. If you show up to most lectures and do the reading you should get at least a B.
Very condescending to students. Not very helpful or responsive.

Very enthusiastic about the subject and pretty clear for being a lit prof! Lays out in simple terms what the meaning of each story is. No essays, no participation grade, just exams. Expect to write a lot on the exams.
Nete is incredibly helpful and awesome. She's one of the best teacher's that I've had at Madison and I loved how enthusiastic and nice she was.

I had her for Lit Trans 275 last semester and I have her now for Lit Trans 324.  She is the sweetest lady ever and she is very knowledgable.  She truely loves what she does and is very willing to help.

I got an A but it wasnt as easy as I would have predicted. Class is not curved but questions on exams can be tough. Exams are graded by TA's so talk to her about them afterward and she will award you extra points. Very nice teacher.
easy prof. read the book and you will get an AB at least. no need to go to class.

Her class consists almost entirely of guest lectures, most of which are quite interesting. If you have any interest in Scandinavian culture or history, I highly recommend this class. There was only one graded assignment all year, a book report on a novel. There are two midterms that she graded pretty harshly, just make sure to study a lot!

She is a really nice lady, but she only lectures like 3 times over the semester.  A guest lecturer on a different topic every day, with readings for each.  Read one book and write a 2 page book report, one midterm (short answer and essay), and one final. It's a lot of info to take in, but study and you'll do alright. Wish she would teach more tho!

Probably one of the easiest classes you'll ever take. I sat in class and did crossword puzzles. Tests are really easy. She teaches a lot of history that is pretty much irrelevant. Just read the stories and you'll do fine. Comm b is like a high school english class.
Hans Christian Andersen...easy class, dont have to go to lecture, just read stories, tests easy...take for easy good grade
